ygData.subject: Re: Leveling
ygData.msgSnippet: I think the great one was talking about the item spaces on his char, not his bank. You don t want to walk around with those giant satchels from the Bazzarr-- i
ygData.messageBody:
I think the great one was talking about the item
spaces on his char, not his bank. You don't want to walk
around with those giant satchels from the Bazzarr-- i
think they weight around 25 or more stones each!!!!
Those toolboxes can be bought in Thurgadin too-- at
least they were when I bought them. <br><br>Ahhh....
the good old days. I forgot that I lost a lvl 5 char
in the Gfaydark-- never found him and just started
over by getting a new rusty scimitar and cloth
armor!!<br><br>When I started my Chanter, it was the first char I
took to CB in nearly a year. It was sooo funny,
because even on Xev (one of the newest regular servers,
though almost a year and a half old) I was finding a lot
of true newbies. OMG-- trying to explain /assist,
targeting, avoiding hits, pet control, nuking, the benefit
of the snare spell-- things we just take for
granted. I remember being teamed with 2 erudites in CB at
level 8-- these were their 1st chars-- How did they get
all the way to CB????? It was funny and sad because
one of them died later and was bound in Erudin.
<br><br>I have played a lot of classes up to the mid 20s,
and still find it amazing how many times players
don't know about the most beneficial spells/abilities.
Showing a rogue how to evade, and my favorite is
explaining Harmony to a druid. There is so much to this game
and so much to each class. Heck, I had to /bonk my RL
friend for not ever casting his stun spells as a Pally,
and he's level 40!!!!<br><br>ok ok ok enough for
today<br><br>X.
